gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.OneD
Class FunctionViewComponent

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.OneD.FunctionViewComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IViewComponent, IViewComponent1D, IAxisAddible, ILegendAddible, IOverlayAddible, ITruLogAxisAddible, IZoomAddible, IZoomTextAddible, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
public class FunctionViewComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements IViewComponent1D, java.awt.event.ActionListener, IZoomTextAddible, ITruLogAxisAddible, IPreserveState, java.io.Serializable, ILegendAddible

This class allows the user to view data in the form of an image. Meaning is given to the data by way of overlays, which add calibration, selection, and annotation abilities.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

PRECISION

public static final java.lang.String PRECISION
"Precision" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the precision this view component will have. Precision affects the significant digits displayed on the Axis Overlay, among other things. The value that this key references is a primative integer, with value > 0.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FONT

public static final java.lang.String FONT
"Font" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the font used by this view component. This font will also be passed on to overlays, such as the Axis, Annotation, and Selection. The value that this key references is of type Font.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ANNOTATION_OVERLAY

public static final java.lang.String ANNOTATION_OVERLAY
"AnnotationOverlay" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the Annotation Overlay. Since the overlay has its own state, this value is of type ObjectState, and contains the state of the overlay.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final java.lang.String AXIS_OVERLAY_2D
"AxisOverlay2D" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the Axis Overlay. Since the overlay has its own state, this value is of type ObjectState, and contains the state of the overlay.

FUNCTION_CONTROLS

public static final java.lang.String FUNCTION_CONTROLS
"FunctionControls" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the FunctionControls. Since the control has its own state, this value is of type ObjectState, and contains the state of the controls.

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState. Keys will be put in alphabetic order.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Parameters:
isDefault - True if default state, use static variable.
Returns:
if true, the selective default state, else the state for with all possible saved values.

getPrecision

public int getPrecision()
This method will return the precision specified by the user. Precision will be assumed to be 4 if not specified. The overlays will call this method to determine the precision.

Specified by:
getPrecision in interface IAxisAddible
Returns:
precision of displayed values

getControlList

public ViewControl[] getControlList()
This function will return an array of 17 ViewControls which are used by the Function View Component. [0] - Control to choose a selected line. (Line Selected) [1] - Control to choose the style of the chosen line. (Line Style) [2] - Control to choose the thickness of the chosen line. (Line Width) [3] - Control to display point markers for the chosen line. (Point Marker) [4] - Control to choose the size of the point markers for the line. (Point Marker Size) [5] - Control to display error bars for the choosen line. (Error Bars) [6] - Button Control to select the color of the chosen line. (Line Color) [7] - Button Control to select the color of the point markers. (Point Marker Color) [8] - Button Control to select the color of the error bars. (Error Bar Color) [9] - Control to offset the selected lines. (Shift) [10]- Control to set a shift factor to offset the selected lines by. (Shift Factor) [11]- Control to select the axis overlay. (Axis Checkbox) [12]- Control to select the annotation overlay. (Annotation Checkbox) [13]- Control to select the legend overlay. (Legend Checkbox) [14]- Control to select a range for the graph to display. (Graph Range) [15]- Control to show the location of the cursor. (Cursor) [16]- Control to display logarithmic axes. (Logarith Axes)

Returns:
ViewControl[] the array of view controls

This method will return the local coordinate bounds of the center jpanel. To be implemented, the center may have to be a coordjpanel.

getPositiveMin

public float getPositiveMin(int axis)
This method will get the minimum positive value for the x and y axis. The value returned will be greater than zero if a valid axis is passed..

Specified by:
getPositiveMin in interface ITruLogAxisAddible
Parameters:
axis - The axis to get the positive minimum. Use the static ints provided by the ITruLogAxisAddible interface.
Returns:
The smallest positive float value for the specified axis.

getBoundScaleFactor

public float getBoundScaleFactor(int axis)
This method will get the scale factor used, if any, to alter the size of the bounds. A scale factor of 1.05 will increase the bounds by 5% while a scale factor of .8 will decrease the bounds by 20%.

Specified by:
getBoundScaleFactor in interface ITruLogAxisAddible
